"Help Me Up\nv1.0"

"Thank you for using the Help Me Up System. Your protection is just minutes away but first we need you to do a brief system setup. We will step you through the setup process as well as provide you additional information on how this app works."

"The setup process will contain 3 mandatory sections and 2 optional sections.
The sections are broken down as follows: 
1) Permissions 
2) Bluetooth Connection 
3) Emergency Contact List 
4) (Optional) Alarm and Messaging 
5) (Optional) Additional Features and Navigation"
"Section 1\nPermissions"

"All permissions used by this application are essential for the Help Me Up System to work. None of these features will be used to track your personal information or modify your phones functionality in any way. There are 6 types of permissions needed that will be broken down next."
"Permissions are required for the following 6 functions: "
"Bluetooth Access"
"Send SMS Message"
"Access Location"
"Modify Audio Settings"
"Internet Access"
"Access Contacts"
"Click an image or text above to see why the permission is required for the Help Me Up System."

"Bluetooth is the only way the Fall Sensor Device and the Messenger Application can communicate with each other. If a fall occurs, bluetooth must be enabled so that the Fall Sensor Device can notify the Messenger Application of an emergency."
"SMS is required to notify the people you select in your emergency contact list through SMS messaging. Without SMS nobody can be notified of a fall. Standard data rates apply."
"The Help Me Up System needs your location so that when a fall occurs your contacts can be given your GPS location. Without location positioning it may take days to find people who fall."

"When a fall occurs an audio alarm will be needed for two reasons. In the case of a fall, the audio alarm will notify people nearby that something has gone wrong. In the case a panic or fall event has been resolved, the user or others will know they need to stop the messaging."
"Internet access is required for GPS location services as well as for database usage. Without internet access certain services for the Help Me Up System will become unusable."

"Your contacts are required so that the app can provide you options for your emergency contact list. Without contact access the Help Me Up System will not be able to find people to notify during a fall."
"Your permissions have been accepted! Click next to continue."
"You must accept all permissions to continue. You can click the above permissions to see why they are required."
"Section 2\nBluetooth Connection"
"The bluetooth connection requires you to search for the device and select it. This section will give an easy step-by-step guide to this process."
"When you first see the window there will be a list of paired devices and 4 buttons. When the screen pops up click on the search button."
"The search button is the bottom right button near the top of the screen."
"After you click the search button a second list will pop up below the list of paired devices as shown in the red circle."
"Search for a device with Help Me Up in the name and then click on it to connect the device through bluetooth."
"If the connection is successful the device will show up your paired list above when you open this in the future."
"You are now finished with setting up the bluetooth connection. Next will be the Emergency Contact List setup."
"Section 3\nEmergency Contact List"

"Now that the bluetooth connection with the Fall Sensor Device has been established, you will need to select people from your contacts list to be used as emergency contacts. The Help Me Up System will notify these emergency contacts if a fall or other emergency occurs ."
"There are two different lists used by the device: the contact list with all your contacts and the emergency list which contains the numbers of the contacts you wish to contact during an emergency."
"Now to setup your emergency list you will have to first select contacts from the contact list."
"After you open up your contact list click on a name of a contact you want to use as an emergency contact."
"When that contact is selected a new list will pop up with all the phone numbers associated with that contact."
"You can choose as many phone numbers for that contact as you like."
"In general it is best to use as many valid phone numbers for that contact as possible so that you increase the odds of a quick emergency response."
"When you click a phone number it will be highlighted green, if you click it again it will go back to white."
"Only green phone numbers will be added to the Emergency List."
"When you open up this list in the future you may notice green highlights for certain contacts."
"Contacts highlighted green are contacts used for your emergency list."
"After you have selected all the phone numbers you want added to the emergency list just scroll down to the OK button and press it to finalize changes."
"The emergency list will show the current phones numbers you will contact during an emergency."
"Additionally the number of numbers and people you will contact is listed. We recommend 3 to 6 people that you contact."
"You can also modify the Emergency List by clicking the contacts button."

"You are now finished with all 3 mandatory sections. If you would like to see additional features and learn how to navigate the app press the "Section 4" Button. If you would like to finish the initial setup press the "Finish" Button.
"Section 4\nMessaging and Alarms"
"Thank you for taking your time to finish the initial setup. You are free to do as you please!"

"When you fall or press the panic button the messaging process will occur after a set amount of time (60 seconds by default). Every number in your emergency list will be sent a message that says an emergency has occurred along with your location so they can find you."
"The text message to your contacts will be similar to the following: \n\nHelp! I have fallen at 5555 Deer Road, San Diego California 92130 USA"
"The message process will send out messages to your emergency contacts periodically (default 180 seconds) until 20 messages have been sent or the Fall alarm is cancelled."
"Before the messaging process occurs an alarm will go off notifying a fall or panic button press has happened."
"In the case of a false alarm simply press the alarm to cancel and avoid having messages sent out to emergency contacts."
"You can customize the noise and alarm delay under settings. The alarm will make a loud noise and will have an animation when it goes off."
"The goal of having a dramatic alarm is to draw in people that can help you in case of an emergency."

"This concludes Alarm and Messaging. If you would like to see Additional Features and Navigation click the "Section 5" Button. If you would like to finish the initial setup press the "Finish" Button."
"Section 5\nAdditional Features and Navigation"
"This section will go through the following additional features: Database and Settings. Then will finish off with navigation and background processes. "
"The database is split up into two different lists: The event list and the reliability list. They both can be accessed on the top right corner."
"The event list will display two types of events: Falls and Panic Button Presses. Press the event to see more information about it."
"The reliability list will show any errors with the Help Me Up System."
"Reliability issues can range from bluetooth connection issues, battery issues, or any fatal system errors."
"Both lists will display events in order from most recent event to oldest event. It will store information for a limited period of time."
"Settings will allow you to modify the following Help Me Up System elements: your alarm tone, messaging delay, messaging frequency, and display settings."
"To change a particular setting simply press one of the button options under each labeled subsection of the settings."
"The app has a simple navigation structure. The app will stay on the main screen during normal usage. "
"As described before the middle button is used for cancelling an alarm. Below the alarm will be a timer that counts down until messages are sent.
"Near the bottom is a contacts button used to choose emergency contacts. On the top right corner is a drop down menu which has several options."
"From the dropdown menu you can get to the database, emergency contact list, bluetooth setup, and the settings menu."
"Future updates may add additional things to the main screen such as battery display."

"The Messenger App must work 24/7 so it will do work in the background. It will simply need to be able to receive Fall Sensor Device messages through bluetooth. In the case of a fall or panic button press the device will also wake up for the user to interact with. "

"Finally the messenger app will automatically start up on turning on your phone to insure your covered whenever your app and sensor device are in range of each other. Background processes will not make use of other phone features and will not disable any phone functionality."
"You have now completed the entire initial setup process! Thank you for using the Help Me Up System!"
